questions.question: What is the function of AWS edge locations?

options.text: Reduce latency by caching content closer to users

questions.question: In the shared responsibility model, what is AWS responsible for?
Which of the following is a characteristic of server-side encryption?

options.text: The server decrypts data at the client’s request
The server encrypts data when it is stored
The client encrypts data before sending it to the server
The client decrypts data on the server

questions.question: Which of the following is true about the account root user in AWS?

options.text: It has full access to all AWS resources
It can only access S3 buckets
It should be used for daily administrative tasks
It has limited permissions by default

questions.question: What is an IAM role used for?
How is an AWS Region defined?

options.text: A geographical area with one or more Availability Zones

questions.question: Which of the following best describes cloud architecture?

options.text: Applying cloud characteristics to meet technical needs and business use cases
Designing only for private cloud environments

questions.question: What is a key takeaway of cloud architecting?

options.text: Minimize cloud costs at all costs
Use AWS services to create highly available, scalable, and reliable architectures

questions.question: What is the role of a cloud architect?

options.text: Analyze solutions for business needs and requirements
Set pricing strategies for cloud services

questions.question: A company wants to reduce the storage costs of items that they access regularly but do not need instant access to. Which Amazon S3 storage class best fits this need?
What does an organization need to do in Amazon IAM to enable user access to services being launched in a new region?

options.text: Create new user accounts in the new region
Update the user accounts to allow access from another region
Enable global mode in IAM to provision the required access

questions.question: A junior architect has overwritten a document in an S3 bucket by mistake. They want to prevent this from happening in the future. Which feature of Amazon S3 should they implement?
A company is required to keep customer data for 10 years for regulatory compliance. How can they transition data between storage classes without using manual processes?

A multi-account organization is using AWS Organizations to manage their accounts. The company wants to enforce certain restrictions, such as preventing accounts from enabling specific services or features, which apply to all their AWS accounts. Which permission mechanism best fits this use case?

A research company needs to provide access to a group of employees from different departments to manage the customer support portal that’s hosted on AWS. Which AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) identity type would be most suitable for this scenario?

options.text: IAM user with only CLI access

questions.question: A Cloud Practitioner needs to decide which Amazon S3 storage class to use for storing copies of backup data. The storage must provide rapid access when needed but resiliency can be low. Which storage class is most suitable?

A large organization uses AWS to host their web applications. They want to define fine-grained access control for their applications, ensuring that developers only have access to specific resources within their respective projects. Which permission mechanism best fits this requirement?
A developer wants to grant secure long-term access to an S3 bucket across several AWS accounts. Which option can they use to grant secure long-term access to this S3 bucket?

In the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy evaluation process, which best describes the order of steps that are taken when determining whether a principal is allowed or denied access to a specific resource?

options.text: Check explicit allow, check explicit deny, check for absence of rules
Check for absence of rules, check explicit allow, check explicit deny
Check explicit deny, check explicit allow, apply implicit deny if there are no explicit rules.

questions.question: A local bank wants to grant a contractor access to a specific S3 bucket for data migration purposes. Which AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) identity type should be used in this scenario?

A manufacturer wants to grant permissions to a new chief technology officer (CTO). They need permanent access to manage AWS resources, allowing them to create, modify, and delete resources as needed. Which AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) identity type should be used in this scenario?
A developer wants to store 10 years of data logs cost efficiently. Which service can support this workload?
What do you need to log into the AWS console?
How can a company configure automatic, asynchronous copying of objects in Amazon S3 buckets across regions?

options.text: This is done by default by AWS

questions.question: How should IAM policies be attached according to best practices?
Which of the following is an IAM best practice?

options.text: Use long-term credentials for IAM users
Grant full permissions to all users
Store root access keys in a local file

questions.question: What does the Operational Excellence pillar emphasize?

options.text: Running and monitoring systems that deliver business value

questions.question: Which AWS service provides multi-region data replication for a NoSQL database?
An organization wants to monitor all network traffic flowing to and from specific instances in a VPC for security analysis. What feature should they enable?
A company plans to host a database server in a VPC and wants to isolate it from the internet. What configuration ensures this server remains private?

options.text: Deploy the server in a public subnet with a security group allowing inbound traffic
Deploy the server in a private subnet
Attach an Elastic IP to the server
Add an internet gateway to the subnet

questions.question: A VPC design includes a small number of available IP addresses, which limits growth. What change should the architect consider?

options.text: Increase the CIDR block size of the VPC
Create more subnets with smaller CIDR blocks

questions.question: What database option is best for latency-sensitive applications requiring in-memory storage?
Which AWS service includes built-in point-in-time recovery to prevent accidental data loss?
What is the best solution for large-scale data analysis with a focus on cost efficiency?
Which AWS service is best suited for storing and managing IoT data over time to analyze trends?

A web application running on multiple EC2 instances is experiencing performance issues during high-traffic periods. Which solution will help ensure that traffic is balanced across instances to improve performance?
An organization needs a solution that automatically triggers actions based on predefined CloudWatch alarms. Which AWS service can handle these automated responses?
A developer wants to detect manual changes made outside of CloudFormation for a stack’s resources. Which CloudFormation feature can help identify these differences?
A development team needs an automation tool that integrates with their existing IDE to create infrastructure code with best practices. Which AWS service can support this?

You need a CloudFormation template to support both production and development environments. Production spans two Availability Zones, while development is limited to one. Which section of the CloudFormation template can accomplish this?
Which AWS service provides recommendations for best practices, including high availability, performance, and cost optimization?
Which AWS service allows you to monitor and collect metrics for applications and services across multiple AWS regions?

A development team is troubleshooting their AWS Lambda function that connects with an Amazon RDS MySQL database in a customer’s virtual private cloud (VPC) to store data. Currently the function times out with “too many database connections” error. Which architecture option would fix this problem?

options.text: Launch an RDS proxy service on an EC2 instance in the customer’s VPC. Connect the Lambda function to the RDS proxy service.
Ensure the that Lambda function is attached to the RDS MySQL VPC. Use the Lambda service to configure an RDS connection using RDS proxy.
Launch an Amazon EC2 bastion host instance and connect the Lambda function to the bastion host. Ensure the bastion host has access to the RDS database.
Ensure that the Lambda function is connected to the Lambda service VPC-to-VPC NAT gateway which connects to the customer’s VPC elastic network interface.

questions.question: A data engineer wants to use Spark scripts to parallel batch process raw data. They need to perform extract, transform, and load (ETL) on a CSV file and load it into Parquet format. They do not have the IT and developer staff to configure and monitor the infrastructure or to write the ETL code. Which AWS service would best meet the data engineer’s needs?

A company processes massive streams of data in real-time from IoT devices. The processed data is used for real-time dashboards and analytics. Which AWS service would be the most suitable for this requirement?

A solutions architect is designing a workflow that needs real-time data ingestion. They are considering either Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose or Amazon Kinesis Data Streams for this solution. Which service should the solutions architect choose to meet the requirement of data delivery of less than 10 seconds?

options.text: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams because it has lower latency when compared to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose, which has a minimum buffer of 60 seconds.
Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose because it has lower latency when compared to Amazon Kinesis Data Streams.
Amazon Kinesis Data Streams because it has higher latency when compared to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose because it has higher latency when compared to Amazon Kinesis Data Streams.

questions.question: A company needs to store application error logs for later analysis. The raw data must be preserved, and the data needs to be accessed by more than one team with their specific analysis tools. Which AWS storage service would be the MOST cost effective?

options.text: Amazon S3 as a data lake

questions.question: A stock brokerage company wants to provide a secure, scalable API solution for their AWS resources. Customers can sign up for the free service, which limits API requests per day, or the paid service for unlimited API usage. Which API type would satisfy these requirements?

A solutions architect is tasked to build a production scale application using containers as the compute solution. They decide to use Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS). After setting up their Amazon ECS cluster, which steps should they follow to build a production environment?

options.text: Create a PodSpec and use it to launch one container on Amazon EC2 instance nodes. Add an Application Load Balancer to route traffic to the container.
Create a PodSpec and then deploy containers on Amazon EC2 instance nodes. Specify a Kubernetes service to route traffic to the containers.
Create a service definition. Run the service to deploy containers on Amazon EC2 instance nodes.
Create and run a task definition to deploy containers on Amazon EC2 instance nodes. Set up an Application Load Balancer to route traffic to the containers.

questions.question: To ensure high availability, an application is deployed in multiple availability zones. Which AWS service distributes incoming traffic across these zones?
Which AWS service is best suited for caching dynamic content like live video streaming for global viewers?
Which section of a CloudFormation template is used to define resources like EC2 instances, S3 buckets, and security groups?
What is the primary benefit of using Amazon CloudFront to deliver static content for a website?
A company has configured an Amazon SQS queue with a visibility timeout of 30 seconds. A message is not fully processed within this period. What will happen to this message?

options.text: The message will be sent to a dead-letter queue
The message will become visible in the queue again
The message will trigger an error notification

questions.question: A company must perform asynchronous processing and implement Amazon SQS as part of a decoupled architecture. They want to reduce the number of empty responses from polling requests. What should they configure to minimize empty responses?

options.text: Increase the maximum receives for the redrive policy
Increase the receive message wait time

questions.question: An application requires high availability and needs to roll back to a previous version if the deployment fails. Which CloudFormation feature supports this?
An application needs to decouple a task from other components. Which AWS service should the application use to ensure tasks are queued and processed independently?
Which AWS service allows real-time analysis of metrics and can trigger alarms when thresholds are breached?
Which section of a CloudFormation template enables administrators to pass dynamic values like environment names to the template during deployment?

A national bank has recently migrated to the cloud, but the bank’s executives are not confident in their expertise. They would like a TAM to help them keep their cloud optimized. Which level of AWS Support should you select?
To optimize cache performance, which approach should you take for data that becomes stale after a specific period?

options.text: Set a TTL (Time-to-Live) for cache entries

questions.question: Which AWS construct provides you with your own dedicated virtual network in the cloud?
When would Amazon ElastiCache be a preferred solution over Amazon CloudFront?

options.text: To cache images and static files for global distribution
To improve availability for globally distributed applications
To cache frequently accessed database queries

questions.question: An application requires high availability and sub-second response times. Which scaling option is recommended for this scenario?

options.text: Horizontal scaling with EC2 Auto Scaling groups

questions.question: How should a solutions architect configure access?

options.text: Set up a site-to-site VPN connection between the VPC and the S3 bucket.
Configure AWS PrivateLink between the EC2 instance and the S3 bucket.
Configure a VPC gateway endpoint for Amazon S3 in the VPC.
Create a private hosted zone using Amazon Route 53.

questions.question: What feature of Amazon RDS provides automatic failover for high availability?
A company needs a relational database that can automatically scale with a variable workload and requires minimal management. Which solution best fits these requirements?
Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework focuses on maintaining traceability and applying security at all layers?
Which CloudFormation feature allows you to preview changes before applying them to an existing stack?
Which AWS service can provide DNS failover capabilities to ensure high availability for a global application?
Which of the following is a best practice for building solutions on AWS?
Which principle is fundamental to implementing a strong identity foundation in the AWS cloud?
What is the recommended way to protect data in transit?
An EC2 instance in a private subnet needs to communicate with an Amazon RDS database in another VPC. What is the simplest solution to enable secure communication?

options.text: Set up a VPN connection between the VPCs
Attach an internet gateway to the private subnet

questions.question: A company's VPC is experiencing unintended network access. Which AWS tool helps analyze and identify this network access issue?
A company needs its VPC resources to connect to AWS S3 without incurring internet traffic costs. Which solution best achieves this?

options.text: Assign Elastic IPs to all resources

questions.question: Which database service should you recommend for an application that requires millisecond response times and supports unstructured key-value data?
Which AWS network element allows you to assign a static IPv4 address to an EC2 instance?
A company wants to reduce latency for read-heavy database queries. Which caching strategy should they implement in Amazon ElastiCache?
A company needs to cache frequently accessed session data to reduce database load. Which caching strategy is most appropriate?
Which statement below is incorrect in relation to Security Groups?

options.text: They evaluate all rules before making a decision
They operate at the instance level

questions.question: Your ecommerce application is experiencing high read traffic on an Amazon RDS database, impacting performance. Which solution offers the most cost-effective way to handle increased read traffic?

options.text: Place the RDS database behind a load balancer
Use Amazon CloudFront to cache RDS queries
Configure Amazon ElastiCache to cache frequent queries

questions.question: An Elastic IP Address can be remapped between EC2 instances across which boundaries?

To optimize network traffic for applications, a CloudFormation template needs to configure the right subnet for instances. Which CloudFormation feature can dynamically set the appropriate subnet based on conditions?
Which AWS service should you use to automate the deployment of a layered architecture across multiple accounts?
An application requires an automated deployment process with the ability to roll back automatically in case of failure. Which AWS service is best suited for this scenario?
In the shared responsibility model, what is AWS responsible for?
Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework is focused on matching resources to demand?
What database option is best for latency-sensitive applications requiring in-memory storage?
Which network configuration offers the lowest latency for applications communicating across multiple AZs within a region?

options.text: Deploy instances in a single Availability Zone
Use a load balancer to distribute across AZs
Rely on the AWS private network between AZs

questions.question: A company needs a relational database that can automatically scale with a variable workload and requires minimal management. Which solution best fits these requirements?

options.text: Amazon S3 as a data lake

questions.question: A solutions architect is tasked to build a production scale application using containers as the compute solution. They decide to use Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS). options.text: Create a PodSpec and use it to launch one container on Amazon EC2 instance nodes. Add an Application Load Balancer to route traffic to the container.

Which feature of Amazon SNS ensures that messages are only delivered to subscribers who are currently available?

options.text: Static web content like images and videos

What type of IAM policy is attached directly to an AWS resource?
Which database service should you recommend for an application that requires millisecond response times and supports unstructured key-value data?

A development team is troubleshooting their AWS Lambda function that connects with an Amazon RDS MySQL database in a customer’s virtual private cloud (VPC) to store data. Currently, the function times out with a “too many database connections” error. Which architecture option would fix this problem?

options.text: Launch an RDS proxy service on an EC2 instance in the customer’s VPC. Connect the Lambda function to the RDS proxy service.
Ensure that the Lambda function is connected to the Lambda service VPC-to-VPC NAT gateway, which connects to the customer’s VPC elastic network interface.
Ensure that the Lambda function is attached to the RDS MySQL VPC. Use the Lambda service to configure an RDS connection using RDS proxy.
Launch an Amazon EC2 bastion host instance and connect the Lambda function to the bastion host. Ensure the bastion host has access to the RDS database.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes an Availability Zone in the AWS Cloud?

options.text: One or more physical data centers
One or more edge locations based around the world
A subnet for deploying resources into

A message in an Amazon SQS queue with a visibility timeout of 30 seconds is not fully processed. What will happen?

options.text: The message will trigger an error notification
The message will be sent to a dead-letter queue
The message will become visible in the queue again

questions.question: An ecommerce site using CloudFront experiences high latency in specific regions. What can be done to improve the experience?

options.text: Enable ElastiCache to cache dynamic content
Use an RDS Read Replica in each region

questions.question: Which type of website changes dynamically based on user interaction?
A voting system's database struggles during peak load. Which solution decouples ingestion and ensures votes aren't lost?

options.text: Scale the database horizontally with Multi-AZ deployment
Use AWS Lambda and API Gateway
Use EventBridge to re-provision larger instances during voting
Send votes to SQS and use workers to write to the database

questions.question: A web application faces performance issues during high traffic. Which solution ensures balanced traffic across EC2 instances?
Which caching strategy is effective for workloads with frequent updates and critical data consistency?
Which CloudFormation feature can detect manual changes made outside of a stack?

A solutions architect has created two IAM policies: Policy1 and Policy2. Both policies are attached to an IAM group. A cloud engineer is added as an IAM user to the group. Which action will the cloud engineer be able to perform?

options.text: Deleting logs from Amazon CloudWatch Logs

questions.question: Which scaling option is recommended for this scenario?

options.text: Horizontal scaling with EC2 Auto Scaling groups

questions.question: A company has deployed a web application in a VPC with both public and private subnets. The application servers need internet access to download updates but should not be accessible from the internet. Which solution meets these requirements? (Select TWO)

options.text: Place the application servers in a public subnet.
Place the application servers in a private subnet.
Configure a NAT gateway in a public subnet.
Attach an Elastic IP to the application servers.
Set up an internet gateway in a private subnet.

questions.question: A system designer working for a bank has to choose an AWS workflow orchestration service. They choose the AWS Step Functions service. Which statements are true about AWS Step Functions workflow types? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Standard Workflows offer an exactly-once run model for workflows.
Standard Workflows offer synchronous and asynchronous processing.
Standard Workflows are charged based on the number of requests for the workflow and its duration.
Express Workflows are charged based on the number of state transitions.
Express Workflows offer synchronous and asynchronous workflows.

questions.question: Which are examples of microservice serverless patterns on AWS? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Amazon Kinesis invokes an AWS Lambda function and stores data on Amazon DynamoDB.
Amazon API Gateway invokes an application running on AWS Fargate containers through an Application Load Balancer.
Application Load Balancer invokes an application running on Amazon EC2 instances to store data on an Amazon DynamoDB table.
Application Load Balancer invokes an application running on Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) which stores data on an Amazon Aurora Serverless cluster.
Application Load Balancer invokes an application running on Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) which stores data on an Amazon DynamoDB table.

questions.question: A system designer wants to utilize AWS Lambda functions for a global e-commerce website. Which environments are valid Lambda runtime environments? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) cluster

questions.question: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service can be used to manage which objects? (Select TWO.)
A company must provide access to AWS resources for their employees. Which security practices should they follow? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Create IAM policies based on least privilege principles.
Create IAM Roles and apply them to IAM groups.
Disable password policies and management console access.
Create IAM users in different AWS Regions.

questions.question: What can be assigned to an IAM user? (Select TWO.)

options.text: An access key ID and secret access key
A password for access to the management console
A password for logging into Linux

questions.question: Amazon S3 is typically used for which of the following use cases? (Select TWO.)

A company runs a public-facing three-tier web application in a VPC across multiple Availability Zones. Amazon EC2 instances for the application tier running in private subnets need to download software patches from the internet. However, the EC2 instances cannot be directly accessible from the internet. Which actions should be taken to allow the EC2 instances to download the needed patches? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Define a custom route table with a route to the internet gateway for internet traffic and associate it with the private subnets for the application tier.
Configure a NAT instance in a private subnet.
Assign Elastic IP addresses to the EC2 instances
Define a custom route table with a route to the NAT gateway for internet traffic and associate it with the private subnets for the application tier.
Configure a NAT gateway in a public subnet.

questions.question: Which AWS services can be used to connect the AWS Cloud and on-premises resources? (Select TWO.)

A company’s security team requires that all data stored in the cloud be encrypted at rest at all times using encryption keys stored on premises. Which encryption options meet these requirements? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Use server-side encryption with AWS KMS managed encryption keys (SSE-KMS).
Use an AWS Lambda function invoked by Amazon S3 events to encrypt the data using the customer’s keys.
Use server-side encryption with Amazon S3 managed encryption keys (SSE-S3).
Use client-side encryption to provide at-rest encryption.
Use server-side encryption with customer-provided encryption keys (SSE-C).

questions.question: A solutions architect wants to design a solution to save costs for Amazon EC2 instances that do not need to run during a 2-week company shutdown. The applications running on the EC2 instances store data in instance memory that must be present when the instances resume operation.

options.text: Note the Availability Zone for each EC2 instance before stopping it. Restart the instances in the same Availability Zones after the 2-week company shutdown.
Run the applications on EC2 instances enabled for hibernation. Hibernate the instances before the 2-week company shutdown.
Modify the application to store the data on instance store volumes. Reattach the volumes while restarting them.
Snapshot the EC2 instances before stopping them. Restore the snapshot after restarting the instances.

questions.question: For most use cases, there are two primary patterns for organizing your infrastructure: multi-VPC and multi-account. Multi-VPC strategy is best suited for which use cases? (Select TWO.)
Which types of files can be publicly hosted on an Amazon S3 static website? (Select TWO.)

To optimize network traffic for applications, a CloudFormation template needs to configure the right subnet for instances. Which CloudFormation feature can dynamically set the appropriate subnet based on conditions? Options:
Which AWS service allows real-time analysis of metrics and can trigger alarms when thresholds are breached? Options:
Which actions should be taken to allow EC2 instances in private subnets to download software patches from the internet? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Configure a NAT gateway in a public subnet
Define a custom route table with a route to the internet gateway for internet traffic
Configure a NAT instance in a private subnet
Assign Elastic IP addresses to the EC2 instances
Define a custom route table with a route to the NAT gateway

questions.question: Which CloudFormation feature can detect manual changes made outside of a stack? Options:
An application requires high availability and sub-second response times.

options.text: Horizontal scaling with EC2 Auto Scaling groups
